Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.

Adding a five star review because..well, how could it not be? Unless they completely screw the pooch and force out Reynolds' authority and the influence of the creative team behind the first one, I can't imagine this one not being a slam dunk. Considering the buckets of cash the original brought home, I'm pretty sure the executives are going to let them do whatever the hell they want.

Only problems I could see would be if the execs try and force them back into a PG-13 script and/or they try and get them to rework the script to appeal to the global audience they've been targeting (with success) in their last few films.

If they can get it through their heads that the Deadpool property is a unique entity that cannot be treated like their other mega franchises, then we should be safe from the risk of sequel hell. Example: Both Spider-Man 2'a, Fantastic Four, Silver Surfer, Thor 2, etc etc.
